content:
• Tuesday, May 1, 2012
  • CBT

    Cabot (NYSE:CBT): FQ2 EPS of $0.96 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $844M (+14.2% Y/Y) beats by $39M....

    Cabot (NYSE:CBT): FQ2 EPS of $0.96 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $844M (+14.2% Y/Y) beats by $39M. Shares +2.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:28 PM
  • ASNA

    Ascena Retail Group (NASDAQ:ASNA) agrees to acquire rival retailer Charming Shoppes...

    Ascena Retail Group (NASDAQ:ASNA) agrees to acquire rival retailer Charming Shoppes (NASDAQ:CHRS) for $890M, WSJ reports, hoping the parent company of Lane Bryant will increase ASNA's exposure to the growing market for large women's clothes. An offer of $7.35/share, a 24.6% premium to today's CHRS closing price, may be announced as soon as tomorrow. CHRS +22.7%, ASNA +6.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • UBNT

    Ubiquiti Networks (NASDAQ:UBNT): FQ3 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $91.7M (+79% Y/Y)...

    Ubiquiti Networks (NASDAQ:UBNT): FQ3 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $91.7M (+79% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -4.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • TRLG

    True Religion Apparel (NASDAQ:TRLG): Q1 EPS of $0.40 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $106.8M (+13.9%...

    True Religion Apparel (NASDAQ:TRLG): Q1 EPS of $0.40 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $106.8M (+13.9% Y/Y) beats by $4M. Shares +9.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ): FQ4 EPS of -$0.11 misses by $0.11. Revenue of $110.4M (+71% Y/Y)...

    OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ): FQ4 EPS of -$0.11 misses by $0.11. Revenue of $110.4M (+71% Y/Y) misses by $2.9M. Expects FQ1 revenue of $110M-$120M vs. $115.4M consensus. Expects FY13 revenue of $630M-$700M (back-end loaded), far above $513M consensus. OCZ +4.3% AH. But rivals are lower: STEC -1%. FIO -1.8%. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM
  • JLL

    Jones Lang LaSalle (NYSE:JLL): Q1 EPS of $0.50 beats by $0.30. Revenue of $813.3M (+18.2% Y/Y)...

    Jones Lang LaSalle (NYSE:JLL): Q1 EPS of $0.50 beats by $0.30. Revenue of $813.3M (+18.2% Y/Y) beats by $41M. Shares +1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM

  • Rubicon Technology (RBCN +9.1%) falls 8.5% AH after warning it expects Q1 revenue of $10M and...

    Rubicon Technology (RBCN +9.1%) falls 8.5% AH after warning it expects Q1 revenue of $10M and EPS of -$0.15, below a consensus of $10.3M and -$0.10. It also expects Q2 revenue of $15M-$18M and EPS of -$0.10 to -$0.14, compared with a consensus of $15.9M and -$0.01. Rubicon blames costs related to a new LED wafer contract, and a difficult pricing environment. Shares rallied earlier thanks to Veeco's strong Q1 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM
  • FORM

    FormFactor (NASDAQ:FORM): Q1 EPS of -$0.29 beats by $0.18. Revenue of $34.8M (-13.9% Y/Y) beats...

    FormFactor (NASDAQ:FORM): Q1 EPS of -$0.29 beats by $0.18. Revenue of $34.8M (-13.9% Y/Y) beats by $2.6M. Shares +5.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM
  • IBM

    More on Open Text/EasyLink: Open Text touts how EasyLink's secure communications software...

    More on Open Text/EasyLink: Open Text touts how EasyLink's secure communications software complements its document management software. The deal is an attempt to better compete against rivals such as IBM and EMC, who sport broader product lines. Along with the merger, Open Text is reporting FQ3 revenue of $292.3M (+11% Y/Y) and EPS of $1.01, which missed consensus by $11.9M and $0.15. Like others, it blames sales execution. OTEX -3.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM
  • CALX

    Calix (NYSE:CALX): Q1 EPS of $0.01 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $78.6M (+9.9% Y/Y) misses by...

    Calix (NYSE:CALX): Q1 EPS of $0.01 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $78.6M (+9.9% Y/Y) misses by $2.4M. Shares +5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • BIO

    Bio-Rad Laboratories (NYSE:BIO): Q1 EPS of $1.09 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $486M (+flat% Y/Y)...

    Bio-Rad Laboratories (NYSE:BIO): Q1 EPS of $1.09 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $486M (+flat% Y/Y) misses by $6M. Shares -5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • ACAS

    More on American Capital (NASDAQ:ACAS): NAV of $15.71, +13% Q/Q. Average interest rate on...

    More on American Capital (NASDAQ:ACAS): NAV of $15.71, +13% Q/Q. Average interest rate on debt investments was 11.1%, up 40 bps. 8.1% of loans were on non-accrual vs. 8.7% of loans at end of Q4. The company repurchased $48M of stock during the quarter. Shares +3.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • CVI

    CVR Energy (NYSE:CVI): Q1 EPS of $0.76 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.97B (+69% Y/Y) beats by...

    CVR Energy (NYSE:CVI): Q1 EPS of $0.76 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.97B (+69% Y/Y) beats by $170M. Shares +1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • BGFV

    Big 5 Sporting Goods (NASDAQ:BGFV): Q1 EPS of $0.01 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $218M (-1.2%...

    Big 5 Sporting Goods (NASDAQ:BGFV): Q1 EPS of $0.01 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $218M (-1.2% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • RATE

    Bankrate (NYSE:RATE): Q1 EPS of $0.10 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $125M (+26.1% Y/Y). Shares...

    Bankrate (NYSE:RATE): Q1 EPS of $0.10 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $125M (+26.1% Y/Y). Shares -11.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • OTEX

    Open Text (NASDAQ:OTEX) agrees to acquire EasyLink Services (NASDAQ:ESIC) for ~$310M, or...

    Open Text (NASDAQ:OTEX) agrees to acquire EasyLink Services (NASDAQ:ESIC) for ~$310M, or $7.25/share in cash, a 14% premium to today's closing price. ESIC +12.5%, OTEX -3.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • OPEN

    More on OpenTable's Q1: International revenue, while up 14% Y/Y, was flat Q/Q at $5.6M (14% of...

    More on OpenTable's Q1: International revenue, while up 14% Y/Y, was flat Q/Q at $5.6M (14% of total), which will add to existing fears about the segment. North American revenue +7% Q/Q and +17% Y/Y. North American seated diners +13% Q/Q and +33% Y/Y, international +5% Q/Q and +45% Y/Y. Installed restaurant base and subscription revenue rose only slightly Q/Q - is a restaurant backlash brewing? OPEN -19.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • OPEN

    OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN): Q1 EPS of $0.40 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $39.4M (+17% Y/Y) misses by...

    OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN): Q1 EPS of $0.40 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $39.4M (+17% Y/Y) misses by $0.2M. Expects Q2 revenue of $38.5M-$39.8M and EPS of $0.36-$0.39 vs. consensus of $41.3M and $0.37. Expects 2012 revenue of $158M-$164M and EPS of $1.49-$1.64 vs. consensus of $168.2M and $1.53. Shares -9.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • PLX

    Protalix BioTherapeutics (NYSEMKT:PLX) +22.8% AH after the FDA approves the company's new orphan...

    Protalix BioTherapeutics (NYSEMKT:PLX) +22.8% AH after the FDA approves the company's new orphan drug to treat a form of Gaucher disease.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • MAXR

    DigitalGlobe (DGI): Q1 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $87M (+12.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    DigitalGlobe (DGI): Q1 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $87M (+12.4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +7.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • TRIP

    More on TripAdvisor's Q1: The big earnings beat was fueled by a 20% Y/Y increase in search...

    More on TripAdvisor's Q1: The big earnings beat was fueled by a 20% Y/Y increase in search advertising revenue (79% of total sales), and a 67% increase in subscription/other revenue. The company adds 120M Facebook users have now accessed its services (+34% Y/Y), and its mobile app has been downloaded over 17M times. Sales & marketing expenses rose 30% Y/Y. TRIP +19.1% AH. (PR - PDF)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK): Q1 EPS of $0.18 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $2.42B (+50.1% Y/Y)...

    Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK): Q1 EPS of $0.18 misses by $0.10. Revenue of $2.42B (+50.1% Y/Y) misses by $290M. Revises its capex budget for drilling and completion costs to $7.5B-$8B from $7B-$7.5B in 2012 and $6.5B-$7B from $7.5B-$8.5B in 2013. Shares -1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 14 Comments
  • MRVL

    Cavium (CAVM): Q1 EPS of $0.02 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $52.7M (-17.1% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    Cavium (CAVM): Q1 EPS of $0.02 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $52.7M (-17.1% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • TRIP

    TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP): Q1 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $183.7M (+93% Y/Y) beats...

    TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP): Q1 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $183.7M (+93% Y/Y) beats by $8M. Shares +17.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • ANAD

    Anadigics (NASDAQ:ANAD): Q1 EPS of -$0.21 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $28.4M (-34.7% Y/Y)...

    Anadigics (NASDAQ:ANAD): Q1 EPS of -$0.21 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $28.4M (-34.7% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • CCC-OLD

    Calgon Carbon's (CCC-OLD +7.8%) strong Q1 beat indicates the maker of purification systems is...

    Calgon Carbon's (CCC-OLD +7.8%) strong Q1 beat indicates the maker of purification systems is "back on track," Brean Murray says, even as consumer sales slid 22%. The firm adds that with factors including improved Japan margins, stable pricing and new projects, CCC "appears well positioned to continue growing revenues and earnings for the foreseeable future."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • COP

    ConocoPhillips (COP +3.7%) has no plans to further split its domestic and international arms...

    ConocoPhillips (COP +3.7%) has no plans to further split its domestic and international arms into two E&P companies, CFO Jeff Sheets says, as its large overseas exposure is key to its strategy to become a "unique" investment option. COP today began officially trading as a pure E&P company after spinning off its refining arm into Phillips 66 (NYSE:PSX).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • SHLDQ

    The pride of the S&P 500 today is Sears Holding (SHLD) as it rips a 17.1% gain on heavy volume...

    The pride of the S&P 500 today is Sears Holding (SHLD) as it rips a 17.1% gain on heavy volume off of its Q1 outlook that points to improving performance. Though 6 out of 7 analysts covering Sears rate it a Sell, the 96.4% YTD run of the short-busting stock has the divided attention of analysts. The question of the day on SHLD: How far does the dismemberment go?

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 9 Comments
  • GMET

    GeoMet (GMET -6%) dips after announcing its chairman, president and CEO J. Darby Sere resigned...

    GeoMet (GMET -6%) dips after announcing its chairman, president and CEO J. Darby Sere resigned Monday. The firm says it's retained a financial adviser to review strategic alternatives for the energy company as it faces declining natural-gas prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • MDSO

    Medidata Solutions (MDSO +13.2%) pops after its Q1 easily beat expectations. Revenue jumped 23%...

    Medidata Solutions (MDSO +13.2%) pops after its Q1 easily beat expectations. Revenue jumped 23% Y/Y on strength in its cloud-focused professional-services business. The company also raises FY12 revenue guidance, now expecting to earn between $213M and $217M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • HLF

    A transcript of David Einhorn's questions and management answers on the Herbalife (HLF -26%)...

    A transcript of David Einhorn's questions and management answers on the Herbalife (HLF -26%) conference call shows Einhorn trying to home in on how many retail buyers of the product there are out there vs. distributors who are buying. It's the age-old question for multilevel marketing companies, several others of which are also tumbling: AVP -7.9%, NUS -13.3%, USNA -5.6%. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 11 Comments
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +2.7%) is bouncing a little a day after crashing on news that two high-profile...

    Groupon (GRPN +2.7%) is bouncing a little a day after crashing on news that two high-profile board members would be replaced with AmEx and Deloitte execs. The departure of Starbucks CEO Howard Schultz particularly bothered many investors, given his consumer retail experience. Perhaps another town hall meeting is needed to explain the move.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • SVNTQ

    Savient Pharmaceuticals (SVNT -33%) says in an SEC filing it's been served with a creditor...

    Savient Pharmaceuticals (SVNT -33%) says in an SEC filing it's been served with a creditor derivative action complaint filed by Tang Capital Partners. The complaint alleges, among other things, that the company is insolvent. Savient believes the complaints are without merit, noting however, that it will consider financial transactions that will improve its overall balance sheet.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • LDK

    LDK Solar (LDK -1.9%) isn't joining today's solar rally after Auriga downgrades shares to Sell...

    LDK Solar (LDK -1.9%) isn't joining today's solar rally after Auriga downgrades shares to Sell following the surprising gains that followed yesterday's ugly Q4 report (I, II). In spite of LDK's huge job cuts, the company won't "field a competitive cost structure until well into 2013," the firm argues, and it has little faith in LDK's accounting. Auriga sees "continued losses at LDK Solar that will wipe away all shareholder value by 2014."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • EXPE

    Expedia (EXPE -1.4%) gives back a bit of Friday's huge post-earnings gains after Barclays'...

    Expedia (EXPE -1.4%) gives back a bit of Friday's huge post-earnings gains after Barclays' Anthony DiClemente downgrades shares to Underweight. DiClemente argues Expedia's strong hotel bookings growth is "being driven by deep discounting" that's hurting its margins, and thinks it's limited cash balance will limit future stock buybacks. He's also not crazy about Expedia's valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • RCM

    Accretive Health (AH -6.5%) slips after being downgraded to Neutral earlier today at UBS, citing...

    Accretive Health (AH -6.5%) slips after being downgraded to Neutral earlier today at UBS, citing uncertainty over recent investigations and their impact on its customer base, plus other possible EMTALA violations. The firm also cuts its price target cut to $11 from $29.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • AONEQ

    Heavily-shorted A123 Systems (AONE +9.6%) adds to Friday's gains after announcing it's expanding...

    Heavily-shorted A123 Systems (AONE +9.6%) adds to Friday's gains after announcing it's expanding its electric grid storage product line. A123's grid storage deals (I, II) have been a bright spot for a company whose electric car battery ops have been hit by disappointing sales and recalls.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • WCRX

    Bank of America weighs in on Warner Chilcott's (WCRX +2%) announcement that it's reviewing...

    Bank of America weighs in on Warner Chilcott's (WCRX +2%) announcement that it's reviewing strategic alternatives, saying that "While it is difficult to predict the potential outcome of the strategic review, the process is consistent with our view that building shareholder value is a priority for the company." The bank notes that expense cuts, which could materialize in a sale scenario, would lead to substantial upside to the stock's DCF value.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • SREV

    ServiceSource (SREV -14.2%) dives after its ho-hum guidance overshadows its Q1 beat. The...

    ServiceSource (SREV -14.2%) dives after its ho-hum guidance overshadows its Q1 beat. The company, which provides a cloud-based solution for managing service revenues, expects Q2 revenue of $58.5M-$59.5M and EPS of $0.00-$0.01 (consensus is for $58.8M and $0.01), and 2012 revenue of $246M-$249M and EPS of $0.05-$0.07 (consensus is for $246.1M and $0.06).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • LVS

    While Las Vegas Sands (LVS +1.7%) keeps raking in money from its Macau resorts, it's the planned...

    While Las Vegas Sands (LVS +1.7%) keeps raking in money from its Macau resorts, it's the planned mini-Las Vegas in Spain that could really pay off in the long-term despite the hefty $35B price tag for the project. With Spain's economy tanking, the company is in perfect position to leverage costs lower for a complex that would be roughly half the size of the Vegas Strip and stand a chance of anchoring the continent's scattered gambling population.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM | 3 Comments
  • CAR

    Zipcar (ZIP +0.5%) CEO Scott Griffith says the firm's car-sharing service already has 700K...

    Zipcar (ZIP +0.5%) CEO Scott Griffith says the firm's car-sharing service already has 700K members as it sees plenty of room to expand by tapping into the 10M people who can walk to a Zipcar location in less than 10 minutes. He also notes that typical customers come from younger generations that seem to care more about the smartphone they use than the brand of car they drive.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • MCK

    McKesson (MCK -1.7%) slips on a likely bout of profit-taking after its FQ4 earnings easily beat...

    McKesson (MCK -1.7%) slips on a likely bout of profit-taking after its FQ4 earnings easily beat estimates late yesterday. Net profit rose 23% Y/Y, led by continued growth from the drug wholesaler's distribution business. The stock has outperformed over the past couple months however, gaining over 12% just since March, and investors appear to be taking advantage of the recent strength to take some money off the table.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM -4.6%) heads south as its BlackBerry World developer's conference fails...

    Research In Motion (RIMM -4.6%) heads south as its BlackBerry World developer's conference fails to impress. RIM has been handing out a BlackBerry 10 prototype phone with software almost identical to that of the PlayBook, and has talked up the brilliance of its virtual keypad and camera software. IDC believes RIM's global smartphone share fell over 50% Y/Y in Q1 to 6.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 13 Comments
  • DIN

    DineEquity (DIN +10.3%) runs up a gain after the restaurant operator beats the Q1 earnings...

    DineEquity (DIN +10.3%) runs up a gain after the restaurant operator beats the Q1 earnings estimates of analysts and P.F. Chang's hefty buyout premium spills over on the sector.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • PCL

    Plum Creek Timber's (PCL -4.9%) Q1 earnings fell 24% as the REIT was hurt by weaker earnings at...

    Plum Creek Timber's (PCL -4.9%) Q1 earnings fell 24% as the REIT was hurt by weaker earnings at its real estate business where segment sales rose but missed expectations. For the quarter, EPS was $0.18 vs. $0.24 consensus; revenues rose 22.5% Y/Y to $337M vs. $332M consensus. Q2 EPS guidance was lowered to $0.15-$0.20 vs. $0.27 consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 2 Comments
  • HLF

    More on the Herbalife (HLF -19%) plunge: Saying the company listed 3 groups of distributor as...

    More on the Herbalife (HLF -19%) plunge: Saying the company listed 3 groups of distributor as "at the low end" in a previous filing, Einhorn noted the company stopped disclosing this in its latest 10-K, and wanted to know why. The company responded it did not view the info as valuable. Seems harmless, except now investors have the idea Einhorn is short HLF.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • MAS

    Masco (MAS +6.6%) gains on a solid Q1 earnings beat late yesterday. Profit swung into the black...

    Masco (MAS +6.6%) gains on a solid Q1 earnings beat late yesterday. Profit swung into the black as stronger sales volume from new home construction and remodeling sales channels and growing market share boosted its top line. Growth was especially strong in its hard-hit North American business, which struggled last year with tepid demand amid a weak U.S. housing market.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • HLF

    Herbalife (HLF -16%) plummets after David Einhorn reportedly questions the company's disclosures...

    Herbalife (HLF -16%) plummets after David Einhorn reportedly questions the company's disclosures during the earnings conference call.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 8 Comments
  • VECO

    Veeco's (VECO +15.1%) stronger-than-expected Q1 results and Q2 guidance are also giving a lift...

    Veeco's (VECO +15.1%) stronger-than-expected Q1 results and Q2 guidance are also giving a lift to Rubicon Technology (RBCN +11%) and (to a lesser extent) other LED industry names: LEDS +3%. CREE +3.4%. AIXG +3.5%. GTAT +4.2%. However, Canaccord, Sterne Agee, and Needham are staying cautious on account of concerns about weak LED end-market demand. Canaccord thinks LED TV sales will determine Veeco's 2H and 2013 performance.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 2 Comments
  • APC

    Anadarko Petroleum (APC +3.2%) powers higher after its Q1 profit surged and it booked a huge...

    Anadarko Petroleum (APC +3.2%) powers higher after its Q1 profit surged and it booked a huge gain from a tax-related settlement in Algeria, while higher oil prices and rising production lifted its top line. Reported Q1 capex of $1.7B and expected FY 2012 capex of $6.6B-$6.9B were in-line. APC expects full-year sales volume to rise to a range of 258M-262M boe.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • NUVA

    Spinal implant maker NuVasive (NUVA +17%) pops after its Q1 results easily beat estimates,...

    Spinal implant maker NuVasive (NUVA +17%) pops after its Q1 results easily beat estimates, coming in at the high end of the expected range. Revenue jumped 21% Y/Y on strong sales of its minimally invasive spinal surgery products. William Blair and Baird both upgrade the stock on the back of the better than expected results.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • CATM

    Shares of Cardtronics (CATM +10.1%) ride an upgrade from Piper Jaffray up to Overweight from...

    Shares of Cardtronics (CATM +10.1%) ride an upgrade from Piper Jaffray up to Overweight from Neutral to a double-digit gain. Analysts see the firm's weak margins improving as synergies from acquired businesses and higher equipment sales filter down.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • IPGP

    Range-bound IPG Photonics (IPGP +15.1%) shoots higher after beating Q1 estimates. Though IPG's...

    Range-bound IPG Photonics (IPGP +15.1%) shoots higher after beating Q1 estimates. Though IPG's guidance for Q2 revenue of $128M-$138M and EPS of $0.60-$0.70 is only in-line with a consensus of $134.6M and $0.67, it's calming investors worried about the industrial laser vendor's exposure to the Euro and Chinese manufacturing sectors. IPG's gross margin rose 200 bps Q/Q to 55.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • DAL

    T. Boone Pickens has a warning for Pennsylvania now that the state is providing a $30M subsidy...

    T. Boone Pickens has a warning for Pennsylvania now that the state is providing a $30M subsidy as part of Delta Air Lines' (DAL +1.5%) $180M purchase of a gas refinery: Keep your wallet handy. "The state better get ready because other refineries are going to want subsidies for them, too."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • AMFW

    Engineering and construction firm Foster Wheeler (FWLT +5.1%) gains in spite of posting a...

    Engineering and construction firm Foster Wheeler (FWLT +5.1%) gains in spite of posting a disappointing Q1 this morning on lower revenue. Investors appear to be encouraged by a 77% rise in net earnings, as margins were boosted on a jump in operating profit and higher order bookings from its power group.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • IVAC

    Hard drive equipment maker Intervac (IVAC +13.8%) soars after beating Q1 EPS estimates, and...

    Hard drive equipment maker Intervac (IVAC +13.8%) soars after beating Q1 EPS estimates, and reporting its order backlog grew 26% Q/Q to $41.3M. Other HDD industry players appear to be getting a lift: WDC +3.1%. STX +3.7%. XRTX +2.2%. Needham (Buy) argues Intervac is nearing an "inflection point," with the industry due to reach max capacity by the end of 2012, and notes the company has been trading at just ~20% above book value.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • AVP

    Avon Products' (AVP -6.6%) weak quarterly report drives shares lower as a combination of higher...

    Avon Products' (AVP -6.6%) weak quarterly report drives shares lower as a combination of higher costs and weaker sales overwhelms the cosmetics seller.
